content:
Hi!

For the similarity function on PSET 3, I noticed that I could use try/except blocks (catch a KeyError/IndexError) but I made a function that passed the test cases without using a try/except block. I know that using the try/except block is more relevant but would it be still possible for me to get full points using my current solution without a try/except block as long as all cases are passed?

Thank you!
subject: Different Solutions for Similarity Function

content: I don't think you need to use a try/except block for this pset.
